intro: Aporostylis bifolia, commonly known as the two-leaved spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wet or swampy environments, often in coastal areas. Aporostylis bifolia is an important component of coastal vegetation, contributing to soil stabilization and habitat for various wildlife species.
